noun.description: The inversion of one portion of the intestine within another.
examples: intussusception is the most common cause of bowel obstruction in those 3 months to 6 years of age
an intussusception may be the cause of the child's pain

noun.description: The growth of a cell wall by the deposition of cellulose.
examples: the area of the surface increases uniformly by intussusception

origin: Early 18th century (in the sense absorption): from modern Latin intussusceptio(n-), from Latin intus within + susceptio(n-) (from suscipere take up).
